name: 2-propenoic acid, 2-chloro-
Reason: The compound 2-chloro-2-propenoic acid has a base structure similar to acrylic acid with a chloro substituent added. The base structure of acrylic acid has a melting point around 13°C. The chloro substituent is an electron-withdrawing group and is expected to increase the melting point due to increased dipole moment and stronger intermolecular forces, particularly dipole-dipole attractions. A chloro group can be expected to increase the melting point by about 40-50°C. However, due to the double bond in the compound which offers rigidity and might slightly increase the melting point, I would predict an additional +2-3°C. Lastly, the carboxylic acid group promotes hydrogen bonding which is a strong intermolecular force, typically raising the melting point significantly, but since it is already accounted for in the acrylic acid base structure, no additional increase from this group will be considered for the chloro-substituted analog.
